title: Men and mountains Today Clive Turnbull begins his story of one of Australia's greatest engineering feats—the harnessing of the Snowy, Murray and Tumut rivers to provide power eventually, and water for irrigation. It is, as everyone knows, the Snowy Mountains Hydro-Electric scheme, but despise its immensity, it has been remote to most Australians, something tremendous that has been going on behind the scenes as it were. Here, Turnbull brings it to life in words. His story of the Snowy scheme will be continued tomorrow and end on Wednesday. Other vast enterprises will be described regularly in The Mail and The News. The vast Snowy River scheme AUSTRALIA ON THE MARCH-No. 3 CLIVE TURNBULL introduced this great series in the The News last Friday with a general survey of Australia's calossal industrial expansion.
